item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "I must be a mermaid, Rango. I have no fear of depths and a great fear of shallow living." -- Anais Nin

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Dali Lama
item.description: "We can live without religion and meditation, but we cannot survive without human affection." -- Dali Lama

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "Pulling heads off Barbies, sticking them on the TV antenna and ruining the reception. But thats how witch babies are." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Sabrina Ward Harrison
item.description: "Bless the Mess." -- Sabrina Ward Harrison

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; I lift my eyes and all is born again." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Only the phoenix rises and does not descend. And everything changes. And nothing is truly lost." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Cate Tiernan
item.description: "There is darkness in light, there is pain in joy, and there are thorns on the rose." -- Cate Tiernan

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I'm not blessed, or merciful. I'm just me. I've got a job to do, and I do it. Listen: even as we're talking, I'm there for old and young, innocent and guilty, those who die together and those who die alone. I'm in cars and boats and planes; in hospitals and forests and abbatoirs. For some folks death is a release, and for others death is an abomination, a terrible thing. But in the end, I'm there for all of them." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When writing a novel, that's pretty much entirely what life turns into: 'House burned down. Car stolen. Cat exploded. Did 1500 easy words, so all in all it was a pretty good day." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "How do I know you'll keep your word?" asked Coraline. "I swear it," said the other mother. "I swear it on my own mother's grave." "Does she have a grave?" asked Coraline. "Oh yes," said the other mother. "I put her in there myself. And when I found her trying to crawl out, I put her back." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Allison DuBois
item.description: "If you let people break your spirit and detour you from your path, then you have not been true to yourself or those you're here to touch, those who believe in you." -- Allison DuBois

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There are many humorous things in the world; among them, the white man's notion that he is less savage than the other savages." -- Mark Twain

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "It's very hard to keep your spirits up. You've got to keep selling yourself a bill of goods, and some people are better at lying to themselves than others. If you face reality too much, it kills you.... you've got to find an answer to the question: Why go on?" -- Woody Allen

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "Take pride in your pain; you are stronger than those who have none" -- Lois Lowry

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "Without mysteries, life would be very dull indeed. What would be left to strive for if everything were known?" -- Charles de Lint

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by R. Buckminster Fuller
item.description: "I'm not trying to counsel any of you to do anything really special except dare to think. And to dare to go with the truth. And to dare to really love completely." -- R. Buckminster Fuller

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The intuitive mind is a sacred gift and the rational mind is a faithful servant. We have created a society that honors the servant and has forgotten the gift." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: mathilda_craft add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it." -- Albert Einstein
